summary: This document is an NCIC (National Crime Information Center) delayed response inquiry from the FBI New York office to the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services, dated October 6, 2021. It contains a warning about an expired NCIC protection order record related to the Epstein case, advising against taking law enforcement action based solely on this record and to contact the entering agency for confirmation.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: Listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services, which is the agency responding to the FBI's NCIC inquiry.

events.title: NCIC Delayed Response Inquiry
events.description: The FBI New York office submits a delayed response inquiry to the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services regarding an NCIC protection order file search.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St. Albany, New York 12210
keyFacts: The document is an NCIC inquiry response dated October 6, 2021, from the FBI New York office to the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.
It contains a specific warning about an expired NCIC protection order record, advising law enforcement not to search, detain, or arrest based solely on this record.
The warning instructs contacting the entering agency to confirm the status and terms of the protection order.

The document references federal regulations (Title 28, Part 20 of the Code of Federal Regulations) and the CJIS security policy regarding the proper access, use, and dissemination of NCIC information.
